comments.body: Yes, please!

A temporary solution to your problem would be altering the Gamma Levels in your Game's Files, but yes, Ore Distribution still needs some tweaking. Diamond Veins should probably be a little bigger and more frequent, and Iron needs to be a little more common as well.

I have noticed that yes, iron is way too hard to find, at least compared to what it was before. I haven't even TRIED to find diamonds yet, but so far at the current distribution, branch mining is pretty much utterly useless. I have mostly only found ores in caves, WHICH is great for exploring, but very annoying.

One thing I have noticed though is that it DOES make the game harder, which is a welcome change from the overly easy version that it has become. As you say, however, it does seem to take DOWN the incentive to go caving a bit...In a way. In another way, the challenge is fun.
Op stuff

Lightning strikes underwater really wouldn't hurt anything there, the electricity would harmlessly disperse across the water since the minerals of the water is more conductive than flesh. Even when lightning strikes on the water's surface, fish deeper down are rather unaffected due to the same priceable (fish on the surface can be electrified however).

Not to mention, a feature like this might be turned into a low-effort farm with high rewards which Mojang is trying to avoid.

394237269151 Yes you would be correct and I do want to correct myself that the radius wouldn't be very large like probably a 2x2 or 3x3 area and maybe 2 blocks deep bc Fun Fact: the depth that lightning can go inside of water and still be lethal is 2.2 meters deep [or about 7 feet] so the strike wouldn't go far but it would still affect it and they did just recently make lightning rods able to be waterlogged so maybe something like this could be made and the damage probably be very low
agree
I feel like that would almost make caving too easy, but I might be wrong.

Well, I'm pretty sure that the old cave generation is supposed to fulfill this purpose (connecting caves to make systems). However, the old cave generation currently doesn't generate at negative y levels, and since all noise caves above y 31 are flooded they cannot connect to those either (though the caves being flooded is a bug). But I agree that there's a problem with dead ends.
Yes this "fix" has been so annoying. We should allow players to hold sneak when GUI is open.

Agreed, the change to put them at the bottom also makes them feel emptier and the items stand out more than blocks now especially when they float a bit due to the sprite size, it was better when everything was centered, also easier to see when the shelf is above you
I have an idea, we could use the glow squid ink for the armor trims to glow
Wow! This looks SO COOL! Maybe you can use it to make other mobs glow, too!
Another possible fix would be make the default glint strength 50% and make it look as the 100% we have now and let us up it to 100% (that being the old glint or something)

I agree.

Make the old enchantment glint the new 100% glint strength & glint speed.

People who like it with less effect can do so, and people who like it how it was can have it be like normal.

Why only cater to having less glow? Do both - it makes more sense and is fairer for everyone.

The best idea is to make this optional in the settings, I don't care what it will be by default, but we need to have them back in vanilla in some way, loke we can't do it on bedrock with resource packs, just make it optional.
I think it would be cool if the glow was sharper depending on enchantment quality and quantity.
hm, a useful thing, a good idea
Can you fix the cave biome layout based on this planet minecraft datapack called better cave gen

Everything that made it into the update looks really good! The deep dark and ancient cities in particular are amazing.

The only thing that seems odd to me is the mangrove swamp generation, it tends to generate alongside windswept savannas a lot and make extreme slopes.

Opinions on this prerelease:

Yes- I think mangrove trees were always too dense, so I think decreasing their spawn rate is fine.

No- Enderman spawning in Nether should be changed back to the original light level of 0-7. It’ll be a hassle spawn-proofing hubs if it’s moved to light lvl 11.

Tweaks I would make- I would like to see the ‘Birthday Song’ and ‘It spreads’ advancements to be regular advancements instead of challenge advancements.

I think it's a bad idea to reduce tree number in mangrove swamps. I have a very bad computer and I had 10 FPS in previous snapshots, in a buffet world with only mangrove, while I was generated  new chunk all the time with the creative fly. In a release, with survival walk or even sprint, I (and others owners of a very bad computer) will have (I suppose) 30-40 FPS, and probably over 60 with optimizing mods. So I think it's useless to decrease tree spawning in the mangrove swamps. And it reduce ambiance too !!!!

It would be nice to have an explanation on the motivation for some of these changes. The shulker sensor ones don't make sense to me, and I'm left wondering why were they made. Now it seems to have a less intuitive behaviour as the detection doesn't correspond with the sounds the player hears.

Opinions:

I personally prefer mangrove forest being very very dense. It looked very neat and overgrown and survival in it is difficult.

As for the changes to nether mob spawning, I don't think the change is great. For one thing, building in nether biome is already difficult to spawn proof builds.
The Allay should dance when music is played. Just like Parrots do!
Can you fix the fact that mangrove leaves naturally disappeared because there are sometimes too far from the trunk ; it cause useless lag and it makes the mangrove tree less beautiful.
If you light sculk on fire, it creates soul fire. This can be used in the ancient city instead of soul sand.

Mangrove trees still have leaves that are too far of the trunks and naturally deseapeard. It causes lag and it makes the mangroves trees less beautiful !

please, fix it !
readd protection based enchantments so players dont get one shoted by the warden running away
Fallen Logs this would make wild update more wild
i like the change the warden now is more stronger and i like this

I like the new changes in the recent pre-release! Especially the Warden changes, it is cool to know that the developers are working really hard to make the Warden tougher and not cheese-able. The Warden's sonic boom being able to ignore armor and enchantments is certainly welcome. However, I have a proposal for a change on the next pre-release(if there are any). Could the Warden's sonic boom be protected by "Projectile Protection" or "Blast Protection"? I feel like this change would be beneficial to Minecraft players as a whole. Firstly, it would give players more flexibility and variability in terms of utilizing different armor enchantments. Secondly, Projectile Protection and Blast Protection to some degrees are looked down upon and most players prefer to utilize the go-to "Protection IV" all the time. This change would definitely give "Projectile Protection" and "Blast Protection" more love and attention to players. Other than that, definitely great sets of changes in the recent pre-release!

Even though I understand that the Warden had to be buffed a lot in order to discourage players from fighting a natural disaster, I think the sonic boom should be nullified with uncommonly used methods such as using a chestplate with the Projectile Protection enchantment. So far, there don't seem to be any major issues like game-breaking bugs or performance issues in this snapshot--at least for me.

I kinda think that Sonic Booms should not bypass prot4 completely.I mean, it already knocks shields and armour AND hiding behind blocks off the table, it would be IMPOSSIBLE to escape from the warden if protection comes next. (Killing it would also be impossible,but that is intended). Plus, prot4 nullifies all damage, currently in Java edition. 

As both Sonic Booms and prot4 are both kinda types of magic, maybe prot4 could only do ~50-35% of the dmg reduction it usually does when it comes to sonicbooms?

Lots of fun.

"Failed to download file. Error details: Java runtime manifest is missing the desired component for this platform."

Wish I was able to play on my brand new windows lenovo legion 5 with a ryzen 7 and 3050ti, such a shame it's not supported anymore I guess. 1.18.2 and every previous version run perfectly. :))))))))) Not that I need any version after 1.7.10 anyway.
Please delay it’s not ready
I want a wither potion recipe in all versions.
Give the new challenge advancements an xp reward like all current challenge advancements have.

• MC-251859 - Gear equipping sound plays every time armor/elytra durability changes while equipped

i like that in the previous snapshots. totally not a "bug"

Please revert the changes for the sonic boom to that of 22w15a’s. Having the boom do massive amounts of damage and not bypass armor and enchants would be nice, though I do think it should bypass shields.

Maybe make the portal in the center of the Ancient City have an activator made of netherite if it is even meant to be a portal and maybe make Reinforced Deepslate be the first block to require a netherite pickaxe to mine and collect. I would love to see this make it in and would do anything I can to than you!

Mojang can you fix the issue where Anceint Cities and Mangrove Swamps average spawn is over 1000 block away from your spawn point? The Anceint City would be ok if there was some way to locate it just like a stronghold, but there isn't, so you would be leaving the community to search on average 1000+ block from spawn in every direction and digging 100 blocks into the ground hoping we find one.
plz add fireflies back...

here are a couple things i think are worthy enough 

1: ever so slightly buff back up the warden's ranged attack, just a tinsy bit, like 5 damage or somethin in full unenchanted netherite

2: if you are not making the reinforced deepslate part of a portal, give it back the ability to be moved by pistons and also make it mineable

The warden is still pretty easily cheesable:

-> Get trident w/ unbreaking & loyalty

-> Find cavern w/ warden

-> dig a 3x1 tunnel a few blocks out of the cavern

-> dig a long 2x1 tunnel going further away from cavern

-> Bait warden to front of tunnel by throwing trident/making some noise at front of tunnel

-> Once warden approaches back up into 2x1 section, out of shriek range...warden enters the 3x1 section and stays there.

-> You can find a spot out of shriek range but where you can still hit warden with trident

-> Takes max five minutes of spamming the trident (~60 full power throws) to kill warden

 

This could be pretty easily fixed I think by having the warden get "restless" when it doesn't land any blows & leave the 3x1 tunnel section...it would be much harder to get the 60 trident hits in if the warden doesn't stand still/stay in the tunnel.

I prefer denser and larger mangrove forests; they look amazing and much better. It's unfortunate that fireflies are gone, but at least we have wardens and ancient cities, these are one of the BEST additions to minecraft, and I hope there will be more terrifying enemies and huge dungeons! They're great for making youtube videos and reactions, which will further popularize Minecraft.

Still, I sure wish we can have fireflies and firefly bottles as light blocks in the future, maybe in the end update? Please don't just add enderman variants in the end update, hostile mobs need more creature variety like dragons, arthropods, fishes, etc. Perhaps a scary doppelganger enemy like herobrine can be memorable and iconic too! Magic and spells also fit well.

In the future, I'm really hoping for an actual wild update. Mobs like crickets can add a ton of immersion and ambience to Minecraft, and they can be food for frogs, axolotls, fish. Ambient sound effects like rustling leaves, sea winds, and cave drips are also great. Now THAT's a wild update!

I feel like the deep dark still needs more sculk material, especially shriekers. There's too much boring gray. It's too easy to clear an ancient city without any warden spawning. Wardens should spawn easier; three sculk shrieker activation should be enough to summon the warden!
There is the bug, that the recipe for torches isn't in the book, if you only have charcoal.

I'm asking about not added advancement in 1.19 which we were told about on official site at the latest telling about the relise on java edition. It's FROM DIRT TO MUD. You told as about it, but it DOESN'T EXIST. Sorry for caps lock i just want you to see things i want to tell you.

I object to the "global" chat reporting option. This feels like an overreach and a way for mojang/microsoft to take control of a community out of server operators hands.
Let us moderate our communities in the way that we want them to! If someone doesn't feel "safe" or "comfy" on a server, they don't have to play on it! ESPECIALLY if they're playing on it for free and the owner is shouldering all of the costs.

Changes are good but there just seems to be no logic to the allay duplication to me. What does an amethyst shard have to do with anything? Just a very boring and uninspired thing to add - it feels more a case of feeling forced to add a use for amethyst even if it makes no sense whatsoever. Changing the item to be an echo shard would make more sense thematically and give that item another use (and giving more reason to find an ancient city) which I think would be a small improvement, though I still don't really understand why straight up duplication of a mob was added to begin with.

since the 22w24a page links to here for feedback on it i shall give my feedback for it here

"We are looking for feedback regarding the Chat Reporting feature." my feedback is to remove it.

The thing that i hate the idea of is a reporting feature, adding that as a feature is a terrible idea in my opinion is because a server or a realm's rules can be completely different when you compare it with the rules of another server or realm, and chat is included within most rules if there are even any rules within one of these worlds or realms in the first place.
Adding a reporting feature would mean that a user's Microsoft account or possibly another means of online connection within the game could get banned no matter if the action of such user was following the server/realm rules or not, especially since it would most likely depend on rules decided by Microsoft instead.

Sure, having a chat profanity filter being added to realms beforehand is already debatable enough, but it's still understandable since it's not a 100% forced filter like on bedrock edition and isn't something to worry about when a reporting feature isn't involved as well, there should be no need for a reporting feature with a good enough chat filter, but you may think otherwise if both the Microsoft team and the Mojang team think poorly enough of the chat filter that they have designed to the point of them wanting to add a report feature as well.

I had this exact same idea, only I think it might give the player more control if the row in the dispenser they place the copper horn would depict the sound it plays (since there are 3 rows, top = looking up, middle = straight, and bottom = crouching) This could allow up to 9 unique sounds to be randomized out of 1 single dispenser! I play mostly singleplayer, so this would be an amazing feature, especially alongside noteblocks. . .
this is an AWESOME idea, it would give new variety to automated redstone orchestras
What?! no! thats a bad idea, mud is dirt and water, the two things that aren't supposed to be in the nether
not naturally it's not. but it should almost instantly turn to  dirt in the nether sense water is a no no in the nether
Or what if it converts into sand finally giving us renewable sand
This is a great idea considering that you can dry mud into clay with dripstones as well.
Enchantment table is not working for me too.
Fizz
great!
I don't think it should be the apple. The apple already has the golden and enchanted golden variant. Amethyst berries don't sound bad though
how would this apple be crafted? because currently amethyst is way to common for these effects to be justified
They would be crafted by one apple surrounded by 8 crystals but I don't think it would be overpowered. You can get gold way faster then waiting for crystals to grow.
it should be chorus fruit, we already have golden apples, carrots and melons, what about adding some end flavour?
That would be very late game and annoying since you would teleport every time you ate the chorus fruit.
I like the idea of amethyst sweet berries! They would look similar to grapes just like how golden apples are similar to yellow apples.
Jion
There should be no gamerule, maybe a social spy though?
?
Interesting wording but I support this, banners now look horrible in shelves

I have to agree the recent changes for the grass blocks needs to be changed back.

The game now SOUNDS INCONSISTENT with this change.  Such a change should be a PLAYER OPTION with regards to sound changes, just like game controls for 
mouse, keyboard, video, etc.  Everyone playing the game will have a different "Taste" for the game sounds and making a global change like this adds more inconsistency 
to the game, as well as removes that fun original flavor of the game.   You were aware of this in the past, as you would have "Programmers Art" for those who did not like 
the graphics changes, and they could re-load the original textures of the game they were used to. If you decide NOT to revert this sound change, at least have an option for 
us older players who actually LIKE that loud grass break sound to load your "Programmers Sound" option into the game so we can hear the sounds like we have in v1.21.4.   I may have to version lock myself to v1.21.4, until a mod pack or sound tweak of some kind is available via the mod community, if this simple sound roll-back or 
player option to roll it back is not addressed.  I have been playing this game for well over 10 years, and know how it should "feel" like, and I don't normally need to bark on your changes, as up to this time, they have been relatively mild and have improved the game.  
But I consider global sound changes an option by the player when it comes to

"turning down the volume".   Please address this.

I thought it was a bug at first, but the leaves and grass blocks are way too quiet.

I don't know why they had to change it since there's already a slider to turn down block noises. I can't turn the slider above 100%, and even if I could the new sound is balanced so poorly with the old sounds everything else would be too loud. I suppose some people had the opposite opinion, that grass was too loud, and turning it down would make everything else too quiet. But breaking a grass block then a dirt block really shows the difference in volume. At least make it an option of some kind or balance it better.

It really takes away from that Minecraft nostalgia & ambiance for me. I also never comment on changes made to the game, but this really does seem like a complete overcorrection at best.

When I updated to 1.12.5, I was convinced that the lower volume for breaking plants was a bug. The difference in volume between the other sounds for breaking blocks and the one for breaking plants is grating to my ears. The volume of the plants breaking is too low, and there is no way to increase it without modifying the game.

The Minecraft Community found a work-around for this Sound issue that cropped up in v1.21.5.  If you search for a Mod-Pack for this issue, many have made Minecraft Mod packs with the 4 original sounds which were in v1.21.4 and before, to get the grass break sounds back to the way you remember them.

My son helped me load the mod pack with the 4 original sounds, so now the game sounds like it did when it was v1.21.4.  The mod packs are apparently an option for those who wish to tweak the game.  

Many times this is to maintain the original spirit and flavor of the game.  Many have 
had an issue with this grass break sound issue, and some have made mod packs for 
this with the original 4 sounds.   Apparently, I was not the only one annoyed with this.

The mod pack keeps your "custom" settings, so if the game updates, you will retain 
your original grass block break sounds which you are used to.  

There is a menu in the game to load the mod pack, once you have it.

I like this idea. My thoughts for maximum speeds by rail type:

  • (Regular) copper rail: max speed 32 blocks/second
  • Exposed copper rail: max speed 24 blocks/second
  • Weathered copper rail: max speed 16 blocks/second
  • Oxidized copper rail: max speed 8 blocks/second (default maximum speed)

Maybe powered rails made with gold could still exist, with some kind of extra buff to speed? Maybe each copper rail can accelerate a minecart 1-2 blocks/second based on oxidation level, while gold rails can accelerate a minecart 4-8 blocks/second?

To craft copper rails, I suggest 4 iron ingots, 2 copper ingots, 1 redstone dust, 1 stick, and as an option, 1 honeycomb to craft waxed copper rails. Having rails made with 6 copper ingots would be very cheap, so the iron helps to balance it out. 8 rails from this crafting recipe seems like a fair number to me. To wax rails that are already crafted and/or oxidized, either right clicking on a rail with honeycomb in hand could wax it, or 8 rails surrounding 1 honeycomb in a crafting table could wax all 8 rails.
Do you mean us
Great idea!
整成一些科技感的感觉还挺不错🌚
Agreed, it would also help with letting players set the mood of their builds. For example, a haunted mansion or something.
If it is possible in a future update, this should be added since it gives the shriekers a use, creating atmosphere in builds.

I agree, this makes the most sense as the shrieker being able to activate and cause darkness outside of the deep dark is logical, and so is it not being able to summon a warden outside of the deep dark. I think the Warden being native to only the deep dark makes sense, but not the darkness effect being stuck there as well.
It will make it impossible to loot ancient city

The only thing that I would change is instead of having a recipe book in the chests, it should instead be gained from getting an Echo Shard, like most other recipies.

Other than that, great idea and solution to this problem
